thread.title: Disney Launches Paid Subscription Service in the UK Next Month
thread.title_full: Disney Launches Paid Subscription Service in the UK Next Month

author: Aaron Richardson
title: Disney Launches Paid Subscription Service in the UK Next Month
text:
Twitter 
Disney has announced plans to launch its subscription service here in the UK which offers not only movies and TV shows, but books and music direct to consumers all for a monthly cost of £9.99. 
DisneyLife as it’s called, will be launching with a number of titles including all Pixar movies including Toy Story, as well as Disney Classics such as Snow White and The Jungle Book. Seeing as services like Netflix and Amazon Prime Instant Video have become increasingly popular, it comes as no surprise that studios are deciding to profit on their own service. 
“This is the future, in many respects,” said Bob Iger, Disney’s chief executive. “We’re seeing more and more opportunities to reach consumers directly and not through middlemen, and we’re seeing consumers wanting product in different ways.” 
The service is set to launch in the UK next month, but will be rolling across Europe next year. As for a launch in the US, there are currently no plans, but Iger has said that they wouldn’t rule it out. 
As for other Disney properties, such as movies produced by Marvel and Lucasfilm, won’t be included in the service, but Iger revealed that services dedicated to these studios could launch in the future. 
“There’s a general sense that the world is going in this direction,” he said. “There will be multichannel TV and we will be part of it, but the app experience offers many more layers (and) much more richness in content than a channel, where one program follows another program.” 
While £9.99 for a full-on Disney experience sounds like a pretty neat idea, having to fork out an additional fee for Marvel and Star Wars flicks does seem like a bit of a cash grab. TAGS
